meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>compose</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to compose</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You want <vocabulary>to compose</vocabulary> a poem but all you have for inspiration is what's in your pocket. You reach in and find a <reading>yo</reading>-yo (よ). Ah yes, this will do. So you compose a poem about your yo-yo:

One string to rule them all,
One string to find them,
One string to- hey wait a minute...
